title: How to Make Belgian Fries

steps.headline: Start by washing and peeling the potatoes.
Cut them into fries from about a 1 centimeter (0.4 in) square.
Wash them in cold water.
steps.description: This way the most of the starch will be removed and it makes the fries more crispy and delicious.

steps.headline: Dry them with kitchen paper or a towel until they are completely dry.
Fry the fries.
steps.description: Pour the oil in a deep fryer and set at a temperature from 160°C (320°F). Do not overload the deep fryer otherwise, your fries will stick together and they will be not that tasty. Fry the fries for about 8 minutes (depending on how thick they are).

steps.headline: Take the fries out of the deep fryer and lay them into a bowl covered with kitchen paper.
steps.description: The kitchen paper will absorb the excess oil. Leave the fries alone for about 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Fry them for the second time.
steps.description: Set the temperature from the deep fryer at a temperature from 190°C (375°F), and fry them for about 2-4 minutes till they are crispy and golden brown. And lay them into the bowl with a new piece of kitchen paper, so that it can absorb the excess oil again.

steps.headline: Serve the fries with mayonnaise and a little salt if you prefer.

text: Start by washing and peeling the potatoes.  Cut them into fries from about a 1 centimeter (0.4 in) square.  Wash them in cold water. This way the most of the starch will be removed and it makes the fries more crispy and delicious. Dry them with kitchen paper or a towel until they are completely dry.  Fry the fries. Pour the oil in a deep fryer and set at a temperature from 160°C (320°F). Do not overload the deep fryer otherwise, your fries will stick together and they will be not that tasty. Fry the fries for about 8 minutes (depending on how thick they are). Take the fries out of the deep fryer and lay them into a bowl covered with kitchen paper. The kitchen paper will absorb the excess oil. Leave the fries alone for about 20 minutes. Fry them for the second time. Set the temperature from the deep fryer at a temperature from 190°C (375°F), and fry them for about 2-4 minutes till they are crispy and golden brown. And lay them into the bowl with a new piece of kitchen paper, so that it can absorb the excess oil again. Serve the fries with mayonnaise and a little salt if you prefer.
sentences: Start by washing and peeling the potatoes.
Cut them into fries from about a 1 centimeter (0.4 in) square.
This way the most of the starch will be removed and it makes the fries more crispy and delicious.
Dry them with kitchen paper or a towel until they are completely dry.
Pour the oil in a deep fryer and set at a temperature from 160°C (320°F).
Do not overload the deep fryer otherwise, your fries will stick together and they will be not that tasty.
Fry the fries for about 8 minutes (depending on how thick they are).
Take the fries out of the deep fryer and lay them into a bowl covered with kitchen paper.
The kitchen paper will absorb the excess oil.
Leave the fries alone for about 20 minutes.
Fry them for the second time.
Set the temperature from the deep fryer at a temperature from 190°C (375°F), and fry them for about 2-4 minutes till they are crispy and golden brown.
And lay them into the bowl with a new piece of kitchen paper, so that it can absorb the excess oil again.
Serve the fries with mayonnaise and a little salt if you prefer.
